intro: Gonocarpus benthamii, commonly known as the bentham's gonocarpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in wet, swampy habitats and is often found in marshy areas near rivers. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
